text: Hi <@U06Q8FXRBRP> yes sure we use it so, but what i need is the grid of instagram also, so we can see all the graphics we schedule

Hi, we've embedded HubSpot forms on our website and enabled the setting "set as raw HTML". Our developers added external CSS, but the 2 columns aren't displaying on our website, see City and Postal Code. Link to website: <https://www.equitone.com/en/contact/> Does anyone know what we need to change in order to see the 2 columns? Thank you!

Both the columns are set to use 50% of the space - but the gap between them is set to 20px which is causing the issue.  You could either set the percentages smaller than 50% and/or change the gap size - or you could set the flex-wrap setting to "no-wrap"
Hi Scott, thank you for checking! I'll pas this message to our developers. :grinning:

Looking for a career change - Curious about being a HubSpot developer

I have a background in Lead Generation. I worked on a Salesforce implementation a long time ago and enjoyed it.
I'm considering a move out of my current role. I would like to get something that works from home and was looking into getting HubSpot certification.
For those of you who do HubSpot development full-time, I have a few questions:
1. How's that market? How hard is it to find work?
2. Is remote work readily available?
3. What's the general starting pay for a developer?
4. Any advice for someone in my spot? Specific certifications to focus on, etc?
